result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean F Scheid

records.addlTxt:
Motion and Order for Substitution of Attorney /s/ MDZ 10/12/22 
Atty Tori Nanstad is hereby substituted for Atty Jerome Babiak
Motion and Order for Substitution of Attorney filed by Atty Jerome Babiak (sent to Br 1 Judge on 10/12/22 sp)
Pre-trial conference on October 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:37 PM Defendant Sean F Scheid appeared by video, in custody in the Waupaca County Jail.  Attorney Kelly Cassidy appears on behalf of DA Louis John Molepske Jr. for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jerome J Babiak in court for Sean F Scheid. 

3:37 p.m.  Detective Justin Klein sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Cassidy.
3:41 p.m.  Witness identifies the defendant.
3:43 p.m.  Exhibit #P1, copy of criminal complaint, is marked for ADA Cassidy.
3:44 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Babiak.
3:44 p.m.  ADA Cassidy has no redirect.
ADA Cassidy has no further witnesses.
ADA Cassidy would ask that Exhibit #P1 be moved into evidence.  No objection.  
ADA Cassidy would ask that the Court take Judicial Notice on Adams County Case 21CF47.
ADA Cassidy has no further argument.
Atty Babiak has no witnesses and no final argument.

BY THE COURT:
Judicial Notice is taken on 21CF47.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:38 PM Defendant Sean F Scheid appeared by video, in custody at the Waupaca County Jail.   Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jerome J Babiak in court for Sean F Scheid. 

Atty Mutchler provides Atty Babiak with a copy of the criminal complaint.
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.
Atty Babiak would enter a Not Guilty plea on Count 2

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 
Not Guilty plea accepted on Count 2.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Demand for Discovery & Disclosure filed by Atty Jerome J Babiak
filed by Atty Jerome J Babiak
Initial Appearance set for May 9, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 2

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places: D.R. Jr., D.W., H.E., D.O.
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons. 
If posted, participate in the day report program, which includes electronic monitoring to ensure whereabouts at all times.

Defendant Sean Scheid appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jedidiah Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Taylor Soule appears in person on behalf of Defendant.

11:01 AM Court calls case.
Atty Dodge states appearances.

Matter is set for a riverside hearing.

ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of felon in possession of firearm, party to a crime. Investigation is still ongoing. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender. Defendant is eligible for representation.

State requests a cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule addresses the Court regarding bond.
Hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
